data.title: The Gazette from Montreal, Quebec, Canada
data.meta_description: Get this The Gazette page for free from Tuesday, January 10, 1995 and and and a a a THE GAZETTE, MONTREAL, BIRTHS BIRTHS COMMINS-LACHANCE Christine and John are happy.... Edition of The Gazette
data.text:
and and and a a a THE GAZETTE, MONTREAL, BIRTHS BIRTHS COMMINS-LACHANCE Christine and John are happy to announce the birth of their first child, Marianne Aputik, born December 30, 1994, weighing 7 10 ozs, in Kuujiuaq, Quebec. Proud grandparents are Giselle and Gilles Lachance of A Gatineau and Mary and Ted Commins of Montreal. GAVARD-HERRON Sabrina is happy to announce the birth of her sister, Vanessa, on December 31, 1994, at 2:47 p.m., weighing 5 ozs. Two proud parents are Claire Ross. Many thanks to Dr .

F. Joubarne, and the de la Hospital staff. PARENT. Alisha- 6 Marie, 11 born January at 5:06 p.m. is sister for Myles and daughter for proud parents, Nancy and Rick Parent of D.D.O., Quebec .

SPENCER the long Bob and awaited Tricia arrival proudly, announce Warren's brother; Brook Jordan, born January 9, at 2:31 p.m., weighing 8 5 ozs. Proud grandparents are Gerald and Inez Warren of Mallorytown, Ontario and Robert and Hannah Spencer, of London, Ontario. Thank you for miracle to Dr. Senikas, Dr. Mangle and the superb nursing staff at the Royal Victoria Hospital .

DEATHS ADAMS, Murray Edward. Aged fifty- four, of Halifax, died January 6, 1995 at the Halifax Infirmary. He was born in Halifax and was the son of the late George Albert and Florence Adams. He worked in Montreal at the G.H. Woods Company for twenty-one years and returned to Halifax in 1983 and worked at National Sea Products, and a at the time of his death was employed by the Halifax Housing Authority .

He is survived by his first wife, Clara Boyd, his second wife, Alice Falls, survived by daughters, Ruthanne (Toronto), Dale (Halifax), and a stepdaughter Clorise (Halifax), sons, Larry and Dakota both of Halifax and Trevor (Montreal), one sister Mrs. Dorothy Flint, Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, four brothers, Morris (Toronto), Denis (Halifax), Harold (Dartmouth) and Arthur (Montreal), and four grandchildren, predeceased by brothers, John and George. Funeral service will be held Tuesday at 2 p.m. at Cruikshank's Halifax Funeral Home, 2032 Robie Street with Reverend Dr. W.P .

Clayton officiating. Cremation to follow at Harbourside Crematorium, Halifax. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Halifax Infirmary Intensive Care Unit or the Diabetic Association. BAKER, June Christine (nee Combs). January 9, 1995 at the age of sixtyone .

Beloved wife of Michael James Baker. Cherished mother of Michael David, Lucy, Roslyn, Bethel, Dan, and Christopher. Loving grandmother of Christie-May, Sean and Adam. Also survived by her sisters Heather Macinnis, Joy Albert Baker, Thelma Pike, and Charles Lillian Combs. Funeral service at Armstrong Funeral Home, Chapel, 1640 Cote Vertu, St .

Laurent on Thursday, January 12 at 1 p.m. BENNETT, Frederick Cyril. At l'Acadie, on Friday, January 6, 1995, Frederick Cyril Bennett, aged eightynine years and eleven months, beloved husband of the late Juanita Poitras. Father of Susan and her family. Dear brother of Mrs .

Olive White (late Leslie White) and of three late brothers Douglas, Jack, Brenton, nephews nieces. Also dear friend of Luc and Lucille and their daughters Manon and Upon his wishes, no visitation, his ashes will be buried at the Cote des Neiges Cemetery at a later date. BOND, Florence, (Florrie). Peacefully after a illness at the Reddy Memorial Hospital on January 8, 1995. Florence Sprung, beloved wife of Walter .

Loving mother of Helena (Mrs. Ross Church). Devoted grandmother of Jamie. Loving cousin af Ann (Mrs. Jim Gray) of Brighton, Ontario .

Also survived by many dear relatives and friends. Resting at Feron's Funeral Home, 2035 Wellington Street, Montreal. Funeral service from the chapel on Wednesday, January 11, at 10 a.m. Interment Mount Royal Cemetery. Visiting hours Monday 7 to 9 p.m .

and Tuesday 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m BORLAND, Archie W. Suddenly on Sunday, January 8, 1995 at his home in Ormstown, Quebec. Aged sixty-three yeats. Beloved husband of Shirley McEwen, son of the late Dick and Elizabeth Borland of Verdun. Dear father of Susan Mode (Bruce) of Vankleek Hill, Stephen (Janet) of Ormstown, Julie Leduc (Richard) of Cornwall, and Beth Fanning (Ralph) of Vankleek Hill, loving grandfather of ten grandchildren, and brother of William Borland of Orleans, Ontario .

Resting at the McGerrigle Funeral Home 704 Lampton Street, Ormstown. Visitation Tuesday 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Funeral service from St. Paul's United Church, on Wednesday, January 11 at 1:30 p.m. Interment Union Cemetery .

In lieu of flowers, donations to the Women's Auxiliary of the Barrie Memorial Hospital would be appreciated. BROWN, Georgina (nee Laird). At the age of sixty-seven, after a short illness, died peacefully in her sleep at Mount Sinai Hospital on January 4, 1995. Beloved wife of Arthur Brown. Loving mother of Arthur (Carol); Donald (Barbara); Keith (Julie); Stuart and Robin Brown .

Loving grandmother to Sean, Kerry, Erin, Kim, and Christie Brown and great -grandmother to Kelsee. Also survived by her father, George Laird, sisters Irene Figiel and Donna Cochrane. Memorial service to be held, at St. Thomas Anglican Church, 6897 Somerled Avenue, Montreal, on January 20th, 1 p.m. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Canadian Cancer Society would be appreciated .

CAMPBELL, Inez M. (nee Schultz). At the Lasalle General Hospital on January 8, 1995 in her eighty -fifth year. Beloved wife of the late Ralph W. Campbell .

Survived by her son Ralph, daughter -inlaw Irka and her two granddaughters Tanya and Trina. A private funeral service will be held in the Wray Walton Wray Chapel, 1459 Towers Street (corner of de Maisonneuve Blvd. West), on Tuesday, January 10 at 1 p.m. CHERRY, Olive Gertrude (formerly of Montreal) peacefully at the Sunnybrook Health Science Centre, Toronto, on Saturday, January 7, 1995. Olive Cherry, daughter of the late Arthur Cherry and Mary Lappin .

Lovingly remembered by all of her nieces, nephews, and friends. Funeral mass at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Church, Toronto, on Tuesday, January 10 at 10 a.m. Interment, Mt. Hope Cemetery, Toronto. CLARK, Charles .

On Monday, January 9, 1995 in his eighty- -seventh year, following a brief illness. Loving and dearly beloved husband of Leona Davidovitz Shubin. Son of the late Faigie and Harris Clark. Predeceased by brothers Israel and Moe. Fondly remembered by numerous nieces, nephews, cousins and friends .

Funeral from Paperman and Sons, 3888 Jean Talon West, Tuesday, January 10, at 2:45 p.m. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to the Faigie and Harris Clark Geriatric Clinic at the Jewish General Hospital or to the Shaare Zion Synagogue. CZITRON, Simon On Sunday, January 8, 1995. Beloved husband of Elza Roth. Devoted father and father-in-law of Martin and Marcia of Dundas, Ontario, Tommy and Sandi of Toronto .

Cherished grandfather of Erin, Jennifer and Lindsay. Dear brother of Martin of Rehovot, Israel, and brother-in-law of Moody Citron, Geza and Ibi Roth, Mickey and Esther Roth. Funeral service from Paperman and Sons, 3888 Jean Talon West on Tuesday, January 10 at 1:45 p.m. Burial at the Beth Israel Beth Aaron Congregation section, Kehal Israel Cemetery, Dollard des Ormeaux. Shiva at 5700 Cavendish Blvd .

Cote St Luc. In lieu of gifts, contributions may be made to the Israel Cancer Research Fund, 5800 Cavendish Suite H4W 2T5, 481-2723. TUESDAY, JANUARY 10, 1995 Deaths ADAMS, Murray Edward BAKER, June Christine BENNETT, Frederick Cyril BOND, Florence BORLAND, Archie W. BROWN, Georgina CAMPBELL, Inez M. CHERRY, Olive Gertrude CLARK, Charles CZITRON, Simon DELL, Angus DIES, Almeta DORRINGTON, Mary DRUMMOND, Robin Ellen Elizabeth FALLOW, Ruth FAUBERT, Beatrix FRASCARELLI, Cesidio Leo GILBERT, Patricia Mary GOODMAN, Theodore HARWOOD DE LOTBINIERE, Robert HILLER, Lars HOWES, Frederick Stanley JOHNSON, Sophronia JOHNSTON, Donald Howard KALMIN, Mildred KROL, Maria LIGHTSTONE, Baruch Ben MAXINO, Carmen McGOLDRICK, Michael McLEOD, Florence Hilda METI, Antonio PAULUK, Walter PHILLIPS, Dora SCHWARTZ, Shirley SCHWISBERG, Esther SHEPPARD, Evelyn May SHEWCHUK, Peter SOULE, Roscoe Winston Percy STYGALL, William George TELENKO, Michael WASSON, Terrence WEBSTER, Bruce WENSLEY, Rhona Elizabeth WESBROOK, Mary Elizabeth WIDGINGTON, Frances Obituaries DONEGAN, Michael Frederick DEATHS DELL, Angus .

At Akwesasne, on January 1, 1995. Beloved companion of Doris Nolan. Father of Judy, Mitchell, Thomas, and Dodie. Sisters Horn and Margaret Cardinal. Memorial service on Saturday, January at 11 a.m .

at St. Francis Xavier Mission, Kahnawake. DIES, Almeta In Windsor, Ontario on January 8, 1995 at the age of eighty-five. Predeceased by her husband Abram (1959). Loving mother .

of Mrs. Wilfred Beauchamp (Agnes) of Rochester Hills, Michigan and dearest grandmother of Barbara Beauchamp of Louisville, Kentucky. Mrs. Dies will be intered in Hungtingdon Protestant Cemetery. DORRINGTON, Mary .

Suddenly on January 7, 1995. Beloved wife of the late Ernest Dorrington. Dearest mother of Marie, Maggie, Andrew, Henry, Howard, Leonard, Joe, Frank and Andy. Will be sadly missed by her grandchildren and great Also survived by two sisters, eight brothers and many nieces, nephews, in-laws and friends. Resting at the M.A .

Blythe Bernier Funeral Home, 940 Ogilvy Ave. (at Stuart), Park Extension. Funeral service in the Chapel on Wednesday, January 11, (time to follow). Visiting hours, Tuesday, 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. DRUMMOND, Robin Ellen Elizabeth .

At the Ottawa General Hospital on January 8, 1995, age forty-two. Beloved daughter of John and Joan and dear sister of Tim. Special niece to Warda Drummond, Montreal and Ian and Ann Barclay, Vancouver. A Memorial Service for Robin's friends will be held at St. Bartholomew's Church, 125 MacKay Street, Ottawa at p.m., Wednesday, January 11, 1995 .

Donations to the Ottawa Lupus Association, Research Fund, Suite 200, 1701 Woodward Drive, Ottawa, K2C OR4 in Robin's memory would be deeply appreciated. FALLOW, Ruth (nee Blunden). At the Anna Laberge Hospital, on January 8, 1995 at the age of seventy years. Beloved wife of the late Richard Fallow. Dear mother of Richard (Catherine) and Ron .

A private service will be held at Mount Royal Cemetery. FAUBERT, Beatrix. At the Centre d'Acceuil Henri Bradet, on January 9, lates. Alfred Beatrix Jones, Faubert. beloved Funeral wife of service the from Feron's Funeral Homes Chapel, 1010 Shevchenko Lasalle, on Wednesday, January 11, 1995 at 11:30 a.m .

Interment Veteran's Cemetery, Pointe Claire, Quebec. No visitation at the request of the deceased. FRASCARELLI, Cesidio Leo. In Chomedey, Laval, on January 9, 1995, aged sevent Mr. Cesidio Leo Frascarelli, husband of Matilde Giannini .

Father of Lucie (Yves Auclair), Nick (Diane Bernier) and Joanne. Grandfather of Lyne, Sandy, Tina, Laura, Michael. Also survived by nieces and nephews. Donations to the Quebec Diabetes Association and or to the Quebec Heart Foundation would be appreciated. At the request of the deceased there be no visitation .

Funeral Service Thursday, January 12, at 11 a.m. the Notre Dame de la Defense Church. Arrangements entrusted to Urgel Bourgie Ltd. GILBERT, Patricia Mary "'Pat'' (nee Lambert). Peacefully on January 5, 1995 at Claresholm, Alberta, after a brief illness .

Beloved wife of Leslie and loving mother of Bruce (Sheila) of Halifax, Ron (Lorraine) of Claresholm, Keith (Danielle) of St. Lambert and Bill (Debbie) of Medicine Hat. Sadly missed by ten grandchildren and six greatgrandchildren. Also survived by brother Charles (Jessie) of Kingston. A memorial service and interment will be held at Montreal Memorial Park in June .

For further information, please contact Keith Sunday, January 8, 1995. Beloved husband of Sara. Devoted father and father of Ava Goodman, David and Rachel Goodman, Bev and George Torok. Cherished Grandpa of Stephanie Torok. Dear brother and brother-in-law of Freyda Haller, Minnie and the late Joe Goodman, Dorothy Cohen, Jack and Millie Cohen, and predeceased by his five brothers .

Funeral service from Paperman and Sons, 3888 Jean Talon West, on Tuesday, January 10 at 12:15 p.m. Burial at Field of Remembrance, de la Savane. Shiva at 5380 Bessborough, N.D.G. In lieu of gifts or flowers, donations may be made to the Alzheimer's Groupe (A.G.I.) 5800 Cavendish, Suite 311, H4W 2T5, 485-7233. HARWOOD DE LOTBINIERE, Robert William In Montreal January 8, 1995 at the age of ninety -four .

Husband of the late Elaine Harvey, He leaves to mourn his children Marie, Robert, ElizabethAnne, many grandchildren and great grandchildren. No visitation. Funeral is private. Gilbert at (514) 465-2060. GOODMAN, Theodore (Ted) .

On HILLER, Lars. At the Reddy Memorial Hospital, on December 7, 1994. Funeral service in the Chapel of Wray Walton Wray Funeral Home, 1459 Towers (corner de Maisonneuve West), on Wednesday, January 11, at 11 a.m. Interment Mount Royal Cemetery. HOWES, Frederick Stanley .

Ph.d Electrical Engineering, Professor Emeritus McGill University. On January 5, 1995 in his ninety- eight year. Humanist, engineer, teacher and mentor, administrator, organizer, author, nature lover, world traveller. All these were expressions of Fred's zest for life which he shared with his many friends and associates. He is survived by his wife Margaret Kinney Howes .

A gathering of friends will be at a later date. Donations to McGill University would be appreciated. DEATHS DEATHS JOHNSON, Sophronia (Dot). Peacefully residence on Saturday, January 7, 1995, Sophronia Bergeron, in her ninetythird year. Wife of the late Elmer Johnson of Sutton, Quebec .

Dear mother of Douglas (Angeline), Rollis (Ruth) and James Wilbur Westovers (Joanne) of Brampton, Ontario. Dear grandmother of Christine (Christian of Sutton, Kenneth Johnson of Sutton, Sandra (Jeffrey Upton) of London, Ontario. Ellie May, Jake and Dwight and ten greatgrandchildren. Survived by one sister-inlaw, Hazel Foster of Sutton, and many nieces, nephews, family and friends. She is predeceased by four sisters and five brothers .

Resting at the Desourdy Wilson Funeral, at 31 South Main Sutton, Quebec. Visiting hours on Monday, January 9, 1995, from 2 to 4 pm. and 7 to 9 p.m. and Tuesday from 10 a.m. Funeral service from the Chapel on Tuesday, January 10, 1995, at 1:30 p.m., followed by interment at the Grace Anglican Cemetery in Sutton .

JOHNSTON, Donald Howard. Age fiftyfive, at home on Sunday, January 8, 1995 after a courageous battle with cancer. Beloved husband of Sandra, father of Holly (Robert) and Bill (Deirdre). Son of Howard and Violet, brother of Keith (Christine) and Valerie (Mike). Resting at Demers Funeral Home, 231 Laurier Beloeil, Tuesday, January 10 from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m .

Funeral held at Richelieu Valley United Church, Hertel Street, Beloeil on Wednesday, January 11 at 1 p.m. KALMIN, A Mildred (nee Noseworthy). At the Centre Hospitalier Anna Laberge, Chateauguay, on January 8, 1995 in her eighty-third year. Peacefully, after a long and courageous battle with cancer, dearly loved wife of the late Edward "Eddie" Kalmin (23-02-94). Dearly loved mother and mother-in-law Joan and Douglas Keating of Chateauguay .

Loving Nanny of Cheryl and Greg Junnor, (Brampton, Ontario). Daughter of the late Amelia and John Noseworthy, of St. John's, Newfoundland. Beloved sister of Mariorie (Wm. Bill Martin), St .

John's, Newfoundland. Also, -in-law Gerald "Gerry" Fagan and wife Gertie of Mount Pearl, Newfoundland. Loving aunt of many nieces and nephews in St. John's, Newfoundland and Ontario. Also left to mourn an aunt and uncle and many cousins .

Predeceased by her brothers Thomas and Malcolm, also, his sister Audrey of St. John's, Newfoundland. Resting at the J.F. Wilson and Sons Funeral Home, 5784 Verdun Avenue, Verdun. Funeral service in the chapel on Thursday January 12, at 11 a.m .

Interment Mount Royal Cemetery, (Mount Murray). Visitation Tuesday, January 10th, from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. and Wednesday, January 11th, from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. If so desired, donations to: Foundation du Centre Hospitalier Anna Laberge, 200 Brisebois Chateauguay, Quebec, J6K 4W8, or charity of your choice would BE be appreciated. KROL, Maria (Sala) .

At Montreal on January 8, 1995, at the age of seventy-one years. Mrs. Maria Krol (nee Sala), beloved wife of the lated Edward Krol. Dearest mother of Christine (Michel Malinowski), Alexander (Barbara Chapman) and Stephen (Anushka Mycan). Survived by her sister Helena Sala and her brother Walter Sala .

She will be sadly missed her grandchildren Eva, Isabelle (Ricardo Hrtschan) Mattiew, Philip and great-grandchildren Bianca and Victoria, relatives and friends. Resting at Alfred Dallaire 3254 Bellechasse, Montreal. Visitation Tuesday 2 to 5 p.m. and 7 to 10 p.m. Wednesday from 9 a.m .

Rosary, Tuesday 8 p.m. Funeral service 10 a.m. Wednesday, January 11 at St. Mary Polish Church, 2550 Gascon, thence to du Fleuve Cemetery. LIGHTSTONE, (Lichtenstein), Baruch Ben .

On Saturday, January 7, 1995. Beloved husband of Mary Glyn Klein. Dear brother of Hannah Cohen of Israel and the Late Chaim. Funeral service from Paperman and Sons, 3888 Jean Talon West on Wednesday, January 11 at 10 a.m. Burial at the Workmens Circle Cemetery, de la Savane .

Shiva strictly private. MAXINO, Carmen (Laroche). At the Maisonneuve Hospital on January 9, 1995 at the age of forty-one years. Mrs. Carmen Laroche, husband of Virgilio (Max Maxino) .

She also leaves to mourn her son Philip Laroche Maxino. Also survived by parents, parents-in-law, sisters, brothers, sisters-in-law, brothers-in-law, nieces, nephews, aunts, uncles, and many friends. Resting at Charles E. Rajotte Funeral Home, 3635 Hochelaga (corner Chambly West of PieIX). Funeral service January 12, at 10 a.m .

at the Notre Dame des Victoires Church, 2700 Lacordaire. Interment Berthierville Cemetery. Visitation Wednesday 2 to 5 and 7 to 10 p.m. McGOLDRICK, Michael. Peacefully after a short illness at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital on January 8, 1995, Michael McGoldrick, aged seventy-six .

Beloved husband of Theresa McElhone. Loving father of Susan (Mrs. Rob Axelrad) of Toronto. Dearest grandfather of Heather and Stephanie. Also survived by his sisters Rose Brady, Peggy Laferty of Donegal, Ireland, and many other nieces, nephews, relatives, and friends .

Resting at Feron's Funeral Home, 2252 St. Antoine St. Funeral mass at St. Monica's Church on Wednesday, January 11, at 2 p.m. Interment Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery .

Visiting hours Monday 7 to 9 p.m. and Tuesday 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Canadian Lung Association would be appreciated. OBITUARY MICHAEL FREDERICK DONEGAN Passed away peacefully at his January 9, 1995, at the age of fiftyfour. A resident of Hudson for eight years, Michael was well known in the Montreal Broadcast Industry .

His many years of affiliation with Pulse News at CFCF and his comments on the evening news had made him a familiar personality throughout Quebec and parts of Ontario. Born in Ashford, Middlesex, England, on June 16, 1940, Michael was the son of the late Frederick Michael Donegan and Margaret Mary Stevens. Michael is survived by his wife Marlene, sons Sean (Lori Goldberg) and Scott (Kim MacLeod), and granddaughter Brittany, and sisters Eileen Wershler and Patricia Harvey. He will be remembered by his many colleagues and acquaintance over the years as much more than a vicepresident at CFCF Inc, Michael will be remembered fondly as a good friend. Funeral services will take place Thursday, January 12, at 11:30 a.m .

from St. Thomas Aquinas Church, 413 Main Hudson. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Hudson branch of the V.O.N. would be appreciated. HOURS: From Saturday, Sunday RATES: 60c per DEATHS McLEOD, Florence Hilda .

Passed away at home in Orangeville on Tuesday, January 3, 1995, Florence Hilda Liot in eighty-first year, beloved wife of the late David Keiller McLeod (1982). Loved mother of Charles and his wife Patricia of Orangeville and John and his wife Barbara of Georgetown, dear grandmother of Stephen, Jo-Ann, Barbara- Ann and Sandra and greatgrandmother of Cody and Chelsey, also sadly missed by her sister Esther Thompson. Friends may call at the Dods McNair Funeral Home Chapel 21 First St. Orangeville. Funeral service was held on Thursday January 5, 1995 .

METI, Antonio (Tony). In Montreal, on January 1995, at the age of seventyseven year. Antonio Meti, beloved husband of Marguerite Bleunven. Loving father to Jean, Frank (Angie) and Pat (Enza). Cherished grandfather to Danny, Michael, Vanessa, Chelsea and Ryan .

He is also survived by his brother Sammy (Rose), his sister Isabelle (Frank), his sisters-in-law Marguerite and Lilly, nieces, nephews, cousins and friends. Resting at Urgel Bourgie Ltd, 3661 Jean Talon East. Funeral Service Thursday, January 12, 1995, at 11 a.m. at the Ste. Bernadette Soubirous Church .

Thence to Urgel Bourgie Gardens. Donations to the Montreal Heart Institute Research Foundation would be appreciated. Visitation Tuesday, from 7 to 10 p.m. and Wednesday, from 2 to 5 and 7 to 10 p.m. PAULUK, Walter (Vladimir) .

At St. Eustache on January 6, 1995 at age fiftyeight years. Was employed by General Motors for twenty-eight years. Survived by his son, Randall, daughter, Anna Hudson, two grandchildren, Leesa Hudson and Kevin Pauluk and the late Montgomery Pauluk, brother, Andrew, two sisters, Annie and Lillian, numerous Guay Funeral Home 1004 Oka Road, nieces, nephews, and I cousins. Resting at Deux Montagnes .

Funeral service on January 11 at 10 a.m. in the Chapel. Visitation on Tuesday from 2 to 5 and 7 to 10 p.m., Wednesday from 9 a.m. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Heart and Stroke Foundation would be appreciated. PHILLIPS, Dora (nee Miller) .

Peacefully at Centre d'Acceuil Denis Benjamin Viger on January 9, 1995 at the age of ninety-one. Beloved wife of the late Earl Phillips. Loving mother of John, Melba, Gilbert and the late Carolyn. Devoted grandmother of eight grandchildren and fourteen greatgrandchildren. Resting at the Armstrong Funeral Home, 4275 Sources Blvd .

(corner Roger Pilon) D.D.O. where a funeral service will be held in the chapel on Thursday at 10 a.m. thence to Rideau Memorial Gardens. Visiting Tuesday and Wednesday from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. In lieu of flowers donations to the Canadian Cancer Society or Sun Youth Organization would be appreciated .

SCHWARTZ, (nee Singerman). On Monday Shirley, 9, 1995. Beloved mother and mother-in-law of Sandra and Arthur Fagen, Marty and Linda Schwartz. Dear sister of Irving (Alice) Singerman, Aida (Joe Golberg), Moe (Sadie) Singerman, Ginger (the Late Duddy) Bennett. Cherished grandmother of Terry and Pamela, Barry and Francine, and Leslie Fagen, Allan and Steven Schwartz and great grandmother of Laura, Sara, Estee and Aliza .

Wife of the late David. She will be fondly remembered by her nieces, nephews, family and friends. Funeral service from Paperman and Sons, 3888 Jean Talon West on Wednesday, January 11 at 10:45 a.m. Burial at the Canadian Hebrew Cemetery, de la Savane. Shiva at 973 Melville Chomedey .

SCHWISBERG, Esther (nee Gabriel). On Monday, January 9, 1995, after a lengthy illness, born with courage and dignity and with her family by her side. Cherished wite of the late Harry Edgar Schwisberg. Much beloved mother and mother-in-law of Morris and Vickie Schwisberg of Coral Springs, Florida and Claire and Norman Pearl. Treasured and adored Grammy of Stephanie, Gillian, Lindsay and Justine Pearl .

Grandma of Arnold, Marla and David Schwisberg. Great-grandmother of Zachary and Sandor. Dearly loved sister of Priscilla Gabriel of Calgary and Mina Farber. The family acknowledges with heartfelt thanks the care, compassion and support of Dr. George Michaels, Dr .

Harold Zackon and the Nursing Staff, 5 North St. Mary's on Hospital. Funeral service from Paperman and Sons, 3888 Jean Talon West on Wednesday, January 11 at 12:15 p.m. The family respectfully requests the privilege of observing Shiva in the strictest of privacy. Donations in her memory may be made to the Pulmonary Research Fund, St .

Mary's Hospital Foundation 345-3651. SHEPPARD, Evelyn May (nee Sheppard). On Sunday, January 8, 1995. Finally at rest with her loving husband George. Survived by her family, son George (wife Barbara), and daughter Frances (husband Harold) .

Dear sister of Walt, Art, Alf, George, Myrtis, Floss, Ethel and Jane. She will be greatly missed by her grandchildren Donna, Allen, Karen, Linda, Wendy, Michael and her great-grandsons Don Chris. Resting at Guay Funeral Home, 146 St. Louis, St. Eustache .

Visitation 2 to 5 and 7 to 10 p.m. Tuesday. Funeral service at All Saints Church on Wednesday, January 11 at 2 p.m. Wednesday open at 12 noon. SHEWCHUK, Peter .

Suddenly, at the Lasalle General Hospital, on January 8, 1995. Beloved husband of Stella Wasylyk. Loving father of Joann (Mrs. Wayne Price) and Sandra (Mrs. Daniel Boyd) .

Cherished grandfather of Michael Boyd. Also survived by many loving relatives and friends. Resting at Feron's Funeral Homes, 1010 Shevchenko Lasalle. Funeral Mass at St. John Brebeuf Church, on Wednesday, January 11, 1995 at 10 a.m .

Interment Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery. Visitation 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m., Tuesday. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Canadian Heart Foundation would be appreciated. SOULE, Roscoe Winston Percy. Suddenly at his home, Winston Soules beloved husband of Alice Willey and step-father of Tammy Barnes, brother of Stanley (Carol Sager) of Mystic, Quebec, and Shirley (Roland Maxwell) of Lachute, Funeral service in the Mystic United Church, Tuesday, January 2 .

p.m. Interment at Mystic Cemetery. Funeral arrangements entrusted to Joseph Dion Sons Funeral Home, 248-2911. STYGALL, William (Bill) George. VE2GK, Silent Key .

At the Lakeshore General Hospital, on January 8, 1995 in his eighty- seventh year. Beloved husband of Viola Sutton McNeil, and the late Lillian May Loving father of Barbara Heffell (Lloyd) and George Bruce (Willa Burns). Dear grandfather of Steven and Audrey Heffell, and Joanne and Paul Stygall. Brother of Jack, Walter, and the late Frank (Alice Legault). Stepfather to Lorne McNeil (Aline), Doreen White .

Sadly missed by several grand-stepchildren, Patrick, Kimberly, Brian, Debbie and Jennifer. Resting at J.F. Wilson Sons, 14370 Pierrefonds Boul, Pierrefonds. Chapel service at p.m. Wednesday, January 11 .

Visitation Tuesday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. and Wednesday from 12 noon. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Lakeshore General, Heart Foundation, or charity of your choice would be appreciated. TELENKO, Michael. Suddenly on Saturday, January 7, 1995, to join his loving wife Anne, who very recently passed away .

Cherished father of Terry and Jonaire, both of Vancouver and loving grandfather of Andrew and Alexa. Survived by his sisters Kay Zawitkowski, Sumka (Peter) of Winnipeg, sister Marianne of Ancaster, Rose Kovacs, sister Elicia Dauphin, Manitoba and brother ver Phil Telenko (Mary). He will be sadly missed by many nieces, nephews, dear family relatives, and special friends. He will always be remembered for all the special things he did for others. Loved ones and friends may a visit at Alfred Dallaire Funeral Home 781 Ogilvy, Monday and Tuesday from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m .

Panahyda to be held at 8 p.m both evenings. Funeral service to be held al St. John The Baptist Ukranian Catholic Church, 7905 Stuart, on Wednesday, January 11, at 9:30 a.m. Interment at Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, donations to: Sisters Servants of Mary Immaculate, Ancaster, Ontario, or the Canadian Heart Foundation .

8:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. 987-2311 Also Holidays: 12 noon to 4 p.m. 987-2324 Mass, word Minimum charge $6.00 per day. Prayers .

DEATHS WASSON, Terrence In Dorval on January 8, 1995 at the age of forty-nine years. Beloved husband of Joan Carlson, dear father of Christina, T.J. and Sandra. Also survived by his mother Ada Wasson, brother Ricky and sisters Ann and Shirley. Funeral from the Lakeshore Funeral Home 560 Lakeshore Drive, Dorval on Wednesday, January 11 at noon .

Visitation Tuesday from 2 to 5 and 7 to 10 p.m. WEBSTER, Bruce. At Chateauguay on January 9, 1995, at the age of seventyseven years. Bruce Webster, son of the late A Annie Garrett and Jame Webster. Survived by his sister Freda, many nephews and nieces, many friends .

Resting at Dallaire and Wilson Funeral Home, 123 Maple, Chateauguay. Visitation Wednesday, January 11 from 2 to 5 p.m. and 7 to 9 p.m. Service in the Chapel Thursday, January 12 at 11 a.m. He will be sadly missed by all .

WENSLEY, Rhona Elizabeth (nee Watson). Suddenly at her home on Friday, January 6, 1995. Beloved wife of Roland James Wensley. Dear mother of Elizabeth (Stephen Hopkins) and Catherine (Brent Gilday). Beloved grandmother of Clare, Rosemary and Alison .

A funeral service will be held at St. Peter's Anglican Church, 900 Laird Town of Mount Royal on Tuesday at 12 noon. The family will receive friends at the Church one hour prior to the time of service. In lieu of flowers, donations to St. Peter's Anglican Church or the Fulford Residence, 1221 Guy Street, Montreal, H3H 2K8 would be appreciated .

Arrangements entrusted to the Armstrong Funeral Home. WESBROOK, Mary Elizabeth. East Barnard, Vermont. Mary Elizabeth Wesbrook, eighty, died January at the Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center in Lebanon, New Hampshire. She was born August 31, 1914 in Duluth, Minnesota, daughter of Donald McDermid Wesbrook and Elizabeth (Barney) Wesbrook .

Miss Wesbrook was educated in Montreal, Canada, attended McGill University one year and graduated from Vassar College in 1935. She worked for short time at Royal Typewriter Ltd. in Montreal, Canada. then worked five years for The English and Architectural Departments at McGill University. She was Member of the University Womens' Club in Montreal, Canada .

She enjoyed reading, hand sewing, knitting, and carol singing. She is survived by two sisters, Margaret Wesbrook, East Barnard, Vermont, Janet Davis, Summerland, California, nieces, nephews, grandnieces, and grandnephews. A memorial service will be held at a later date. Arrangements are under the direction of the The Cabot Funeral Home, 1 Rose Hill, Woodstock, Vermont, 05091. In memory of a loving wife, devoted mother and best friend. It's been a year now that you went away And our hearts become heavy this day. Not only for grief and pain we feel, But for the abundance of love you taught and gave, And asked that we never conceal. True, but for a moment in a lifetime we walk alone Without you near, to feel the love you'd always shown. Perhaps on this new morning, on this new day, As we walk proud, for all that you have shown, And let us shed tears of joy, as well of those of sorrow, For letting us say, "You'd been our So sleep my darling, gently sleep, And dream the dreams, you dearly keep, But when we too, come to awaken you, Let us say our thanks to you, and only you .

From your loving husband Gordy, and Jennifer, Wendy, Grant, Puppy, Suzie and Dusty. WISEBERG, Dora. We do not need a special day To bring you to our minds The days we do not think of you Are very hard to find. Allan and Rosalie. WISEBERG, Dora .

'Dr. Mom' has an outspread palm ASSOCIATED PRESS CHICAGO Despite experts' advice, a lot of mothers believe spanking is a good way to discipline young children, a survey found. "Mothers spank fairly frequently they both believe in it and do it often," said Rebecca Socolar, the lead researcher and a clinical assistant professor of pediatrics at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill School of Medicine. Forty-two per cent of the 204 mothers surveyed had spanked their young children in the week before the survey, the authors reported in the January issue of the journal Pediatrics. All of the children were younger than 4 .

Mothers believed more strongly in spanking for dangerous misbehavior such as getting too close to a hot iron than for annoying antics such as splashing water from the bathtub on to the floor, the survey found. The U.S. surgeon-general in 1985 said corporal punishment should be discouraged at home and forbidden in schools. The 49.000-member American Academy of Pediatrics also has urged that it be outlawed in schools and avoided at home. The U.S .

National Association of Social Workers is also on record as opposing all spanking at home and at school. A .
